cufy.convert

Interface Converter

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractConverter, BaseConverter, JSONConverter

    public interface Converter
    A class that can convert instances to different classes. With just a simple gate method (for the caller).
    Since:
    31-Aug-2019
    Version:
    0.1.3
    Author:
    lsafer

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default <I,O> O apply(I object, Clazz<O> type)
      If the input is instance of the given clazz.
      default <I,O> O clone(I object)
      Deep clone the given object.
      <I,O> O convert(ConvertToken<I,O> token)
      Set the ConvertToken.output on the given token to a value of the ConvertToken.input, but as the class specified as in the ConvertToken.outputClazz.
      default <I,O> O convert(I input, O output)
      Convert the given input to the given output.
      default <I,O> O convert(I input, O output, Clazz klazz)
      Convert the given input to the given clazz.

    • Method Detail

      • apply

        default <I,O> O apply(I object,
                      Clazz<O> type)
        If the input is instance of the given clazz. The input will be returned. Otherwise the input will be converted. And foreach element in the input if it's instance of the components type of the given clazz the element will remain. Otherwise the element will be converted. And so on for the elements of the elements.
        Type Parameters:
        I - the type of the input
        O - the type of the output
        Parameters:
        object - the input to apply type to
        type - the clazz to apply
        Returns:
        the input with the given clazz applied
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given 'type' is null
        ConvertException - if any converting exception occurred

      • clone

        default <I,O> O clone(I object)
        Deep clone the given object.
        Type Parameters:
        I - the type of the object
        O - the type of the output
        Parameters:
        object - to be cloned
        Returns:
        a clone of the given object
        Throws:
        ConvertException - if any converting error occurred

      • convert

        default <I,O> O convert(I input,
                        O output)
        Convert the given input to the given output.

        Note: the given output is the final output, so given a null output could throw an exception, since why there is a method converting things into null

        Type Parameters:
        I - the type of the input
        O - the type of the output
        Parameters:
        input - the input instance
        output - the output instance
        Returns:
        the output
        Throws:
        ConvertException - if any conversion exception occurred

      • convert

        default <I,O> O convert(I input,
                        O output,
                        Clazz klazz)
        Convert the given input to the given clazz. Or override the given output if it's valid.
        Type Parameters:
        I - the type of the input
        O - the type of the output
        Parameters:
        input - the input instance
        output - the initial output instance
        klazz - the clazz to convert the input to
        Returns:
        the output
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given 'klazz' is null
        ConvertException - if any convert exception occurs

      • convert

        <I,O> O convert(ConvertToken<I,O> token)
        Set the ConvertToken.output on the given token to a value of the ConvertToken.input, but as the class specified as in the ConvertToken.outputClazz.
        Type Parameters:
        O - the ConvertToken.output of the given token after the converting process
        I - the ConvertToken.input of the given token
        Parameters:
        token - the conversion instance that holds the variables of this conversion
        Returns:
        the output
        Throws:
        ConvertException - if any converting error occurred
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given 'token' is null.
